lead_paragraph: The principal of Public School 124 Yung Wing, in Manhattan’s Chinatown, said that none of its students were opting out of the state’s reading and math tests this year.

headline.print_headline: Despite Vocal Protests on State Testing, Few Parents in the City Are Opting Out
headline.main: Despite Protests on State Testing, Some New York City Parents Are Happy to Opt In

snippet: The principal of Public School 124 Yung Wing, in Manhattan’s Chinatown, said that none of its students were opting out of the state’s reading and math tests this year.
abstract: Few parents in Manhattan's public schools are choosing to have their children opt out of New York State math and reading tests for 2016, offering counterpoint to vocal protests that have arisen across state against testing standards; 20 percent of state's students opted out of exams in 2015, but figure was much smaller in New York City, and largely concentrated in small groups of elite schools.
